verses.verse: A Song <S%H7892><s%> of degrees. <S%H4609><s%> To you lift <S%H5375><s%> I up my eyes, <S%H5869><s%> O you that dwell <S%H3427><s%> in the heavens. <S%H8064><s%>

Behold, <S%H2009><s%> as the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of servants <S%H5650><s%> look to the hand <S%H3027><s%> of their masters, <S%H113><s%> and as the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of a maiden <S%H8198><s%> to the hand <S%H3027><s%> of her mistress; <S%H1404><s%> so <S%H3651><s%> our eyes <S%H5869><s%> wait on the LORD <S%H3068><s%> our God, <S%H430><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> that he have mercy <S%H2603><s%> on us.
Have mercy <S%H2603><s%> on us, O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> have mercy <S%H2603><s%> on us: for we are exceedingly <S%H7227><s%> filled <S%H7646><s%> with contempt. <S%H937><s%>

Our soul <S%H5315><s%> is exceedingly <S%H7227><s%> filled <S%H7646><s%> with the scorning <S%H3933><s%> of those that are at ease, <S%H7600><s%> and with the contempt <S%H937><s%> of the proud. <S%H1349><s%>
